so_51820942: for ip in $(cat $filename)
do
  servername=$(dig $nameserver -x $ip +short | sed 's/\.$//')
  echo "set address $servername ip-netmask $ip"
done

so_31016475: (cat filename.txt && echo "text to append") | final_command

(cat filename.txt && echo -n "text to append") | final_command

so_17701989: cat >> filename

so_58210971: find /animals -type d -or -type f \
| grep '/[A-Z]*$' \
| xargs -I + bash -c 'echo -n $(basename +)$( test -d + && echo -n /),\\ ' \
| sed -e 's/, *$//'; echo

grep '/[A-Z]*$'

FROM debian
RUN mkdir -p /animals
WORKDIR /animals
RUN mkdir -p DOGDIR lowerdir && touch DOGDIR/DOG DOGDIR/lowerDOG2 lowerdir/BIRD
ENTRYPOINT [ "/bin/bash" ]
CMD [ "-c" , "find /animals -type d -or -type f | grep '/[A-Z]*$'| xargs -I + bash -c 'echo -n $(basename +)$( test -d + && echo -n /),\\ ' | sed -e 's/, *$//'; echo"]

Explanations about Options.-q:
Quiet; do not write anything to standard output. Exit immediately with zero status
 if any match is found, even if an error was detected. Also see the -s or
 --no-messages option.
